alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:41PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kenedy, northeastern Hidalgo, southeastern Brooks and northwestern Willacy Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 140 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yturria, or 10 miles north of Raymondville, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raymondville, Armstrong, Rachal, Lasara, San Perlita, Norias, Reber Memorial Library, U S 77 Border Patrol Station, Raymondville High School and Rudolph. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 46 and 51. US Highway 77 between mile markers 726 and 762. US Highway 281 between mile markers 732 and 752. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is also occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brooks; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo
